name: Dude Blasters
description:
Dude Blasters is a Local Multiplayer Arena Asteroids Game, where up to 6 players battle it out in a frantic firefight with a frenzy of firepower.

You can have a Free for All or create Teams  (2v2, 3v3, 1v2, 1v5, 2v2v2, etc.). Last Team/Player standing wins!

Players starts off with a single cannon, but as they destroy asteroids they can attach additional cannons and missile launchers.  There are also health packs, and a pick-up that converts regular missiles into homing missiles.

Controls - Xbox Controllers ONLY:

The games controls have been designed for, and only tested with, Xbox Controllers.

  • Move: Left Thumbstick (up/down = forward/back; left/right = rotates)
  • Shields: Right Thumbstick (shields are directional)
  • Cannons: Right Trigger
  • Missiles: Left Trigger

Thoughts:

Dude Blasters, obviously a silly name, was made for an annual LAN party event with friends that we had dubbed "Dude Gaming Weekend" - so I thought the name "Dude Blasters" was fitting title.

This was my first real Multiplayer Game, and after all was said and done I think I'm most proud of Player Select screen. I like that you're able to select your ship, and then organize yourself into any team structure (2v2, 3v3, 2v2v2, 1v5, etc.)

I made a WebGL built, but the Xbox Controller layout didn't work well (i.e. the Right Trigger became assigned to the Start Button).  If there ends up being some interest, or if I find some time, I might try and troubleshoot that and upload a WebGL version. 

Bugs:

I imagine there's some bugs that I am not aware of, and if you find any please feel free to add them to the comments below.  One 'bug' I know of is that players sometimes spawn into the asteroids, but you can just shoot your way out :)
